Package ui

Class Locator

java.lang.Object
ui.Locator
public class Locator extends Object
Locator can be implemented in canvas or other graphing tools to provide a set of dynamic transformations, including resizing, rotating, translating and etc. It helps with graphic designs by converting a ui window or a JPanel into a flexible coordinate system.

Version 2.2 uses unit vectors to support 3 dimensional transformations. It has three coordinate systems, namely constrained coordinates, movable virtual coordinates and resized coordinates, which are defined by three sets of unit vectors.

Version:
2.2
Author:
Yuelong Li

    • setCentered

      public void setCentered(boolean centered)
      Configures whether the (0,0) coordinate is in the center or at the left side of the panel
      Parameters:
      centered -

      true: the coordinate is located where its oringin is in the center

      false: the origin for non-centered locator is at the left center of the panel

      public double[] toxyz(int... Coords)
      Inverse conversion of coordinates --- from screen pixel to original coordinates --- using vector projections
      Parameters:
      Coords - input coordinates in XYZ (screen pixels)
      Returns:
      coordinates that corresponds to the input value

    • toz

      public double toz(int... Coords)
      Inverse conversion of coordinates --- from screen pixel to original z coordinate --- using vector projections

      When the Coords size is 2, the input coordinates will be considered as (x,-,z) by default. Any input size beyond 3 is not accepted.

      Parameters:
      Coords - input coordinates in XYZ (screen pixels)
      Returns:
      coordinates that corresponds to the input value
